The height of the root node is 2, and the number of edges in the longest path from the root node to any leaf node is 13.

The input graph represents a directed acyclic graph (DAG) where each node represents a different entity and the edges represent relationships between these entities. The root node is l, and it has 2 edges coming out of it: m and n. m has 3 edges coming out of it, n has 4 edges coming out of it, and l has 1 edge coming out of it. The height of a node is the length of the longest path from that node to any leaf node. In this case, the height of l is 2 because there are only two edges coming out of it, and both of them lead to leaf nodes (n and q).

The longest path from the root node l to any leaf node is from l to m, m to n, n to o, n to p, n to q, n to r, m to s, s to t, s to u, s to v, s to w, m to x, x to y, x to z, x to ab, x to bb, m to cb, cb to db, cb to eb, cb to fb, cb to gc and finally cb to nc. This path has a total of 13 edges.

Please note that this answer assumes that the input graph is well-formed and represents a valid DAG. If there are any missing or incorrect edges in the input graph, the answer may be different.
